marginalia.translation: Venus is absolutely forbidden to the aging man.

position.marginalia_text: ( Romani semper animo parati, in ( Virtute, Industria ponebant omnia.

marginalia.translation: Romans, always prepared in mind and virtue, proposed industriousness in everything.

position.marginalia_text: ( Vnicus contemnit vulgaria: et contemnitur vulgaris.

marginalia.translation: A unique man holds common things in contempt; a common man is held in contempt.

position.marginalia_text: Cromuellus, Henrico 8. et Cecilius sub ) Elizabeta regina, maximi: nec arte, nec virtute, nec ullo valore magni: sed competenti literaru[m], rerumq[ue] scientia; industria,

marginalia.translation: Great were Cromwell, Henry VIII, and Robert Cecil under Queen Elizabeth. There is no art, virtue, or any valor of a great man, but being competent in letters and the knowledge of things; through industriousness...
Multiplied, it is more wondrous. A human goddess.

position.marginalia_text: The natures of men ar not ripe in few yeares: & what wittes soone mellow, to consider, do, & suffer; with sound discretion, & fitt distinction?
{ Homerus, Hesiodus, Pindarus, maioribus nostris optimi Poeta[e]: quia nescieru[n]t meliores. Sic optimi Oratores, Demosthenes,

marginalia.translation: Homer, Hesiod, and Pindar were much better poets than ours because they knew of no one better. Likewise with the greatest orators Demosthenes, Isocrates, and Cicero.

position.marginalia_text: In vno, voluptas, et foelicitas: In pluribus, tristitia, et miseria.

marginalia.translation: In unity there is pleasure and happiness: in plurality there is sadness and misery.

position.marginalia_text: Juvenes admirentur, laudent, imitentur: liceat viris, a[e]mulari, excellere, [--]

marginalia.translation: Young men admire, praise, and imitate. Men are allowed to emulate, to excel [--]
